summary:
The Tuatha Dé Danann are magical beings from Irish mythology, often seen as ancient gods. They live in a place called the Otherworld but sometimes interact with humans. These beings have special powers and are linked to ancient burial sites. They battle against the Fomorians, representing nature's forces.

Medieval stories describe them as fallen angels or magical people. Some have many names, like different characters, but they might represent various sides of the same god. Over time, they became known as fairies in folklore.
title: Tuatha Dé Danann
